description.narrative: By 2020, primary teachers have improved pedagogical competencies and are better motivated to produce effective learning of literacy and numeracy, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Education â€“ General, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Evaluation And Research, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, more children have equitable access to early learning and complete primary education, acquiring basic literacy and numeracy competencies

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, primary teachers have improved pedagogical competencies and are better motivated to produce effective learning of literacy and numeracy

description.narrative: The alignment of the existent distance teacher training curriculum to the professional qualifications of the pre-service teacher training curriculum under the new law, and development of its correspondent modules are two of the most significant milestones for 2019. This activity has the potential to pave the road for significant sustainable and systematic impact on teachers' pedagogical competencies and qualifications. Evidence generated by UNICEF in partnership with Pedagogic University (UP) triggered discussions on the need to establish a Teacher Trainer Profile and recruitment process | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:09/01/2020

title.narrative: % of School clusters (ZIPs) supplied with materials to support the teaching of literacy, including through reading promotion, and numeracy.
Service Delivery - Teachers - Primary teachers who received training with funding provided by UNICEF
